data.title: ONE OF KALAMAZOO'S OLDEST FAMILY OWNED RESTURANTS
data.text: I moved here in 1971 and Theo & Stacy's was already here. I have eaten here many many times over the years an never been disappointed.. Friendly fast service, great over all menu, specialty is Greek food. They are very local friendly helping people & good causes out & serving a free Thanksgiving dinner to all each year. The prices are right, quality great, quantity good an great fast and friendly service

data.title: Foods taste consistently good, year after year
data.text: I had lunch at Theo and Stacy's last Wednesday. While I was eating I thought about how the Gyro I was eating was as good as the ones I recall eating 20 years ago. That's the thing about Homemade food. The ingredient's don't come in a package made from ingredients that change over the years,such as the Macaroni and Cheese we ate when we were young tasting different now because the company that makes it uses different ingredients now. They come from meats, fruits and vegetables  and spices that are consistently the same year after year. The family has several Restaurants in Kalamazoo and Portage MI. Don't forget to schedule one of them into your trip.

data.title: BEST FOOD
data.text: best food ever, the staff the wonderful, and the owner is so kind. I had the gyro and it was  on top of this world. I recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: This is what I love about a small town
data.text: Restaurants that have been around for decades, and still give great food at a great value.  Theo & Stacy's is well-known favorite of locals in the Kalamazoo area.  And travelers know that the best choices are usually where the locals go.  Breakfast, lunch or dinner, you won't be disappointed here.  And be sure to have the fresh-made baklava for dessert.

data.title: The best
data.text: This Greek restaurant is authentic in ownership, as well as the food. Great prices with a fair amount of food for the value. Very friendly atmosphere.

data.title: Great food, quick service
data.text: Went here for breakfast and they had a nice menu with lots of options.  Food came very quick and quantity did not disappoint.  It is a nice clean place and the servers were very friendly.  I would definitely come again if in Kzoo.

data.title: Best place for breakfast
data.text: I have been to all three places but this is my favorite for breakfast.  We go there regularly after church and I always have the special of bacon, fried eggs, American fries that are the old-fashion hash browns and cinnamon toast.  It is the best meal although I have tried the omelets too.  It is a great bargain.  Staff is friendly and service is great!

data.title: Nice diner which has been around for ever
data.text: This is a Kalamazoo tradition.  You can always count on a solid, inexpensive meal there.  The food is largely tasty.  It's a good place for breakfast or burgers.  You can also get a nice meat loaf or liver and onions.  The vegetables are often bland.

data.title: It's Theo and Stacy's !
data.text: Great food it's been a staple in Kalamazoo for year's I have been going there since I was a child.THE GREEK food place to go (the only one if I'm not mistaken) They also have a decent breakfast and the staff do all kinds of great things for the homeless and the community in general .This place and the owners are what Kalamazoo is supposed to be about,Good food, good people, and helping others in need.

data.title: A must visit for lunch when in Kazoo.
data.text: One of Kazoo's longest serving restaurants, true Greek cuisine. Make sure you say hi to the matriarch, Stacy, who is one of the most pleasant and wonderful people you will ever get a chance to meet.

data.title: Breakfast always
data.text: I have been coming here for breakfast for at least 10 years when I come to Kalamazoo.  I enjoy the breakfast there because it is served quickly and it is tasty.  I come here for 3 or 4 mornings in a row.  They serve other meals but I am away most of every day.

data.title: Good sized spinach omelet
data.text: Had an early appointment do needed an early breakfast place. Theo & Stacy's got the bill nicely. Nothin' fancy here. Just good, straight up breakfast food.

data.title: OK - better some days than others
data.text:
The Greek items on the menu look amazing but have only been there for breakfasts; which are good standard diner fare. The second time we were there the waitress forgot to bring coffee, condiments, toast etc etc she was eating her breakfast in the back while we were waiting for multiple items (some never made it to the table).

Probably won't be back for breakfast when there are so many awesome spots in Kalamazoo, even just down the street but will go back to give the Greek items a try.

data.title: Authentic Mediterranean food at reasonable prices
data.text: I took my entire family and some friends here for lunch this past Sunday. The food was absolutely outstanding and some of the best I've experienced outside of Greece. I specially enjoyed the  stuffed grape leaves.  Great service with the knowledgeable staff.

data.title: Always Good....Great Breakfast
data.text: My husband and I recently went here for breakfast after not having visited in a few years. The food we ordered was well prepared and the prices were reasonable. The two of us each had eggs, meat, potatoes, toast, and coffee for around $13.00 plus tip.

data.title: Blech.
data.text:
My husband picked this spot 

My husband had the gyro, which he enjoyed. I tasted that and agreed it was good. 

Unfortunately, that is what I should have ordered, as well. Instead, I made the mistake of choosing the spinach pie, a house "specialty." Good grief. First, it came with a house salad, iceberg lettuce, (nice) feta, pale tomatoes and a few olives in a pool of oil. Next came the entree. The phyllo was pasty, under-baked. The spinach filling also proved disappointing - gooey. The accompanying green beans came from a can, I suspect. All taste and nutrition had been boiled out of them. The few bites I had, I was surprised the waitress did not pick up on my disappointment, since she had said it was a good choice.

The restaurant itself was dirty and tired. The table was sticky, too. A busboy came around complaining about refilling the sugars, or some such thing. All in all, an experience I would quickly like to forget.

data.title: Best breakfast around
data.text: I know all the Theo and Stacy's are owned by the same family and they make their food all the same.  NOBODY can beat their breakfast.  We've never had lunch or dinner there, but if they're anything like their breakfast, you'll be very happy.

data.title: Breakfast and conversation is fabulous here
data.text: Great food great prices. Cozy and busy. Great breakfast and lunch and dinner. The family serves the whole city food on Holidays and supports the Greek Festival. Amazing family values!

data.title: Greek Dinner ---- just like the old days
data.text: I'm from the east coast and there's nothing like a good Greek Dinner. Theo & Stacy's fit the bill. Comfy, warm and consistent quality.

data.title: Good deal
data.text: great food at a decent price the portions are always big and the service fast and friendly The wait time is minimum to none
